sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Good morning Europe. It's Monday the 27th of December and here are your headlines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: World leaders pay tribute to the anti-apartheid leader Archbishop Desmond Tutu

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: as South Africa begins a week of events to mark his death.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In Belgium, thousands of arts and culture workers have been protesting over the government's restrictions to slow down the spread of the Omicron variant.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And the bodies of at least 28 migrants have been found on Libya's coast after their boat

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: capsized on the world's deadliest migration route.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Across Cape Town, a homage to Archbishop Desmond Tutu, the South African anti-apartheid icon who has died aged 90.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Buildings were lit up in purple after his famous bright clerical gown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tutu won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1984 and battled pancreatic cancer for 20 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Earlier South Africa's president, Simo Ramaphosa, paid his respects to the national hero. He knew in his soul that good would triumph over evil, that justice would prevail over iniquity, and that reconciliation would prevail over revenge and recrimination.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: He knew that apartheid would one day end and that democracy would come.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tutu coined the term Rainbow Nation to describe South Africa and in 1996 led a harrowing journey into the history of apartheid as the head of the Truth and Reconciliation Commission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Outside his long-term residence in Soweto, locals gathered to bid him farewell.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: As you know, this street is the only street where in the world the two Nobel Peace Prize winners have lived. You can then imagine us, the neighbours around, we are really touched by his passing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He'll be missed a lot, played a very important role in the lives of blacks and just the lives of everyone in South Africa had a very huge impact. So he will be dearly missed and may his soul rest in peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Desmond Tutu's impact changed not only South Africa but stretched far into the world, empowering pro-democracy activists and non-violent forms of resistance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: His funeral has been set for the 1st of January.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: As Omicron cases surge past 100,000 a day, the French government is planning to tighten up.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It wants to limit its Covid pass so unvaccinated people won't be able to get one simply on the basis that they've had a negative test.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The pass is required for access to cafes, restaurants and public spaces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In the UK, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland have all tightened up on leisure activities and going out to pubs and cafes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They've resumed social distancing rules and are putting limits on the sizes of gatherings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And England may also tighten up. Prime Minister Boris Johnson said he's not ruling anything out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Portugal will also limit the size of gatherings in the new year and require negative tests for people to enter restaurants and other public places. Omicron has already become the dominant strain, but it also has one of the world's highest rates of vaccination, with around 87 per cent of Portugal's 10 million population fully inoculated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In the state of New South Wales in Australia, there's been a record number of cases and a sharp jump in hospital numbers, even as thousands of people continue to isolate at home. State Minister Brad Hazard said he expected almost everyone to contract Omicron.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The casualties of Europe's migrant crisis. 26 bodies washed up on Libya's western coast. The latest tragedy on the world's deadliest migrant route.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: According to a security official, the body's advanced state of decomposition indicates that the shipwreck happened several days ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He also added that the toll could rise in the coming hours.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Of course, the refrigerator of the Homs hospital can deal with fresh corpses, but decomposing corpses are difficult to work with and store in the refrigerator.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Now the bodies are in the refrigerator and, God willing, they will be shown to the coroner tomorrow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Some were luckier.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Recently, a rescue ship disembarked in Sicily, bringing 214 people to safety.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For them, the ordeal is over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Russia's Gazprom called accusations that the company is reducing supplies to Europe in order to influence prices lies and falsehood.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Moscow says this year's contracts are in some cases even bigger than last year's.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But many countries have already received the full volumes they paid for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They say it was the lack of bids that led to the suspension of pumping through the Yamal-Europe pipeline at the beginning of the week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Gazprom's official spokesman said, There is a physical reversal of gas from Germany to Poland and apparently to Ukraine in the amount of 3 to 5 million cubic meters per day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At the same time, gas is being pumped out from underground storage facilities in Germany, where 47% of the gas has already been taken.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: And winter is just starting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's not the most rational decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I don't even want to speak about the price of such reverse deliveries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: These prices are significantly higher than the prices for contract volumes provided by Gazprom. All the problems in Western Europe are created by themselves. It is better to look at the mirror." After Gazprom stopped reserving Yamal Europe's capacity, gas prices in the EU reached a historic high. Weather forecasts say Europe is in for a very cold winter, and a decision by Germany's Federal Network Agency, which said it has no plans to certify the Nord Stream 2 pipeline until next July, are among the reasons for the sharp jump in gas prices.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Thousands of Sudanese protesters took to the streets two months after a military coup.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: They demanded that soldiers go back to the barracks and called for a transition to full civilian rule.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At least 48 have been killed in weeks of protest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: General Al-Burhan seized power before reinstating civilian leader Hamdok in late November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However many people have refused to accept this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: British police arrested a man on Saturday after a security breach at Windsor Castle, where the Queen was celebrating Christmas. They said he was carrying an offensive weapon and that he entered the grounds at 8.30 in the morning. The authorities also added that security processes were triggered within moments of the man entering the grounds and that he did not enter any buildings. Members of the royal family have been informed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In the state of Kentucky, a team of volunteers has ensured families hit two weeks ago by a string of tornadoes have something to celebrate Christmas with. In the town of Mayfield, the volunteers have served over 30,000 meals since the disaster struck. At least 79 people lost their lives in the tornadoes overnight on December 10.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: 3.6 million people live in the city of Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But alongside them, there are thousands of foxes who also call the German capital home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Biologist Sophia Kimmig has equipped several of the animals with a GPS system and knows a lot about their roots and also about the history of today's Berlin foxes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She says the city foxes that live here, they don't just come from Brandenburg, they have been living here for many generations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Their ancestors moved here to the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They only know this kind of life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And life as a city fox is dangerous, mainly because of the road traffic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On average, urban foxes only live to be one and a half years old.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But why are they hardly ever seen in Berlin?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: According to Kimmig, the reason that you don't see the foxes is that they are really good at making themselves invisible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: She says from the GPS data you can see how they stay on unused land, or really small areas that are fenced in and where they can hide well.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The foxes also find shelter in the capital's parks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Urban foxes have an easier time finding food compared to their rural relatives. They eat rats, mice and will not say no to the occasional kebab or burger.
